section.name: TeX Settings
section.description: Settings for this font as used by a TeX rendering system in this publication project.

setting.name: Font Size Unit
setting.description: Using a value in points (pt), this scales the font size of all elements according to the amount of the value. 1pt is equal to 100%. Example, to decrease the size by 5%, enter the value .095pt. Default = 1pt

setting.name: Line Spacing Factor
setting.description: Scaling factor used to adjust line spacing (leading), relative to font size.

setting.name: Vertical Space Factor
setting.description: Scaling factor used to adjust amount of vertical spaces applied for USFM style sheet SpaceBefore and SpaceAfter values.

section.name: General Settings
section.description: General settings for this font used in this publication project.

setting.name: Use Rendering System
setting.description: The font rendering system (abbreviation) that will be used, e.g. use \"GR\" for Graphite. The supplied font rendering system must be supported by the font, otherwise the field should remain empty. (Note: Because of a bug in XeTeX, the current rendering engine, the default is set to GR. This may not be appropreate for all fonts.)

setting.name: Use Feature
setting.description: List any features needed for this font to render correctly. One or more can be listed, each must be separated by a colon.

setting.name: Use Language
setting.description: The language this font will be working with. Specify the language by using its three letter Ethnologue code. The language must be supported by the font, otherwise the field should remain empty.

setting.name: Use Font Mappings
setting.description: The name of the font mapping file you wish to use. Only one file per component type can be used.

setting.name: Footnote Caller Font
setting.description: Footnote caller characters are normally taken from the default (body text) font. If an alternate (installed) font is specified here, that font will be used for the caller character(s).
